caseTitle: Hafsa Habib Qureshi v. Amir Hamza and others
authorJudge: Mr. Justice Syed Hasan Azhar Rizvi
tagline: (1) The High Court cannot exercise suo motu jurisdiction under Article 199 of the Constitution. (2) Generally, the courts do not interfere in the internal affairs of educational institutions. However, it is not an absolute ban; the courts may step in when educational institutions exceed the defined scope of their authority or act in violation of statutes or laws.
